trashday

Class TrashDaySpeechlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • trashday.TrashDaySpeechlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SpeechletV2

    public class TrashDaySpeechlet
extends Object
implements SpeechletV2
    Handles routing session requests to the appropriate TrashDayManager methods.

    This is mostly boilerplate code from Alexa samples modified to handle the specific Intents for our application. Additionally, the TrashDaySpeechlet(AmazonDynamoDBClient, String) constructor is added to allow the JUnit tests to use a local Dynamo DB instance for testing purposes only.

    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin
    See Also:
    Java Alexa Skills Kit SDK & Samples

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrashDaySpeechlet

        public TrashDaySpeechlet()
        Handle requests using a new connection to the Amazon Dynamo DB cloud. Used for normal Alexa skill requests.

        @CoberturaIgnore used because we don't want to use JUnit tests that involve the Amazon Dynamo DB cloud that may contain user data.

      • TrashDaySpeechlet

        public TrashDaySpeechlet(AmazonDynamoDBClient db,
                         String tableNameOverride)
        Handle requests using a specified Dynamo DB and, optionally, a given table for storing user data. tableNameOverride is only for JUnit tests at this time.
        Parameters:
        db - specific Dynamo DB (instead of the default Dynamo DB cloud)
        tableNameOverride - String table name used by JUnit tests to ensure they do not write to the Production table name (which is hard-coded using @DynamoDBTable in DynamoItem). A null value indicates no override. Any other value is the Dynamo table name to be used.

      • onSessionEnded

        public void onSessionEnded(SpeechletRequestEnvelope<SessionEndedRequest> requestEnvelope)
        Handle the Alexa request when a user session ends.

        At session end, we flush IntentLog information. This records the actions a user performed in order to provide later analysis of how often users use which functions from our skill.

        Specified by:
        onSessionEnded in interface SpeechletV2
        Parameters:
        requestEnvelope - SpeechletRequestEnvelope Alexa request information
        See Also:
        Alexa Skills Kit Docs: Types of Requests Sent by Alexa
